IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE (RELEVANCE) T helper 17 (Th17) cells are critical to immunity at mucosal surfaces such as the intestine, however, these pro- inflammatory cells have also been implicated as mediators of autoimmunity in conditions such as Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD), Multiple Sclerosis, Rheumatoid Arthritis, and Psoriasis. Recent work has highlighted the ability of Th17 cells to convert into other CD4 T cell subtypes, including anti-inflammatory regulatory T cells, providing a strategy for therapeutic intervention. This project investigates the mechanisms that control the stability of Th17 cell identity that can be exploited in autoimmune disease to extinguish damaging inflammatory responses.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Narrative Poxviruses are infectious agents that are causing growing number of infections and have well-acknowledged bioterror potential. Through the work described here we will develop a class of small molecules that block the ability of critical poxvirus machinery to function. We will define how the molecule works and create a high-potency analog that will act as a therapeutic approach to broadly combat poxviral disease.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: Each year, more than $26 billion is spent on treatment and care of babies born prematurely, not accounting for the lifelong impact of developmental and cognitive impairments. Only one approved product is available for prevention of preterm birth in limited cases, so there is significant room for innovation. Herein, we propose studies that build from exciting preliminary data using nanomedicine to address fundamental questions regarding route of administration, pharmacokinetics, as well as validating drugs that could be reformulated and repurposed for more effective prevention of PTB.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF VERMONT & ST AGRIC COLLEGE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Striated muscle myosin molecules are highly organized within exquisite force generating macromolecular complexes, but myosin molecules must somehow be replaced while continually supporting muscle contractility. Our preliminary data demonstrate that the organization of myosin is highly dynamic and rearranges on a minute-to-minute timescale in intact muscle. This project will establish the mechanisms that regulate the dynamic rearrangement of myosin in muscle and provide insight into how we can tune these mechanisms to alter muscle structure.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NURSING RESEARCH
ORG_NAME: WEILL MEDICAL COLL OF CORNELL UNIV
PHR: Project Narrative (Relevance) Family surrogates of critically ill patients experience severe psychological distress that undermines their capacity to make end-of-life decisions congruent with patient values, further exacerbating their risk of prolonged grief, psychological trauma, and regrets. A cycle of emotional pain ensues. Responding to the urgent need for effective, culturally sensitive, and widely accessible interventions for these vulnerable patients and their families, EMPOWER holds great promise for breaking this cycle of emotional pain and promoting family surrogates' psychological adjustment, thereby enhancing their decisional capacity, promoting patients' receipt of values-concordant end- of-life care, and psychological adjustment in bereavement.

PHR: Project Narrative  Aggression, in most cases, is an adaptive behavior but in humans some forms of aggression are considered pathological when they threaten lives and/or increase the risk of psychiatric impairment in victims. This project will examine how the posterior cortical amygdala affects social perception and aggression in an outbred strain of mice.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The changing food environment, with increasingly abundant ultra-processed food (UPF) options, may directly contribute to rising rates of obesity, though it is unknown which ingredients in UPF elevate their reinforcing nature in a way that may lead to overconsumption. The proposed study is the first to systematically examine differences in the rewarding characteristics of and physiological and metabolic responses to UPFs that are high in fat, refined carbohydrates (like sugar), or both. Understanding the biobehavioral underpinnings that enhance the reinforcing potential of ingredients in UPF (e.g., fat vs. refined carbohydrates) can inform novel intervention targets for the treatment of overeating and obesity.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON MINORITY HEALTH AND HEALTH DISPARITIES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE In the U.S., the childhood obesity epidemic disproportionally impacts minority communities, particularly Hispanic children. Minority populations face multiple psychosocial stressors at the individual, household and community level that are associated with increased obesity risk. This research will establish the biological embedment of early-life adversity at the individual, household and community level on epigenetic marks, with the goal of developing early-life biomarkers of risk.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
ORG_NAME: ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE SARS-CoV-2 infection of human cells requires a number of activated human cellular pathways for successful replication. Inhibition of the human mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) pathway blocks SARS-CoV-2 replication, suggesting that MAPK pathway activation is required for viral replication. This project aims to understand how additional MAPK pathways benefit SARS-CoV-2 replication to identify novel drug targets that may be developed for COVID-19 treatment.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON MINORITY HEALTH AND HEALTH DISPARITIES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Latinx adolescents experience a higher prevalence of depressive symptoms and are less likely to receive treatment for depression than their non-Latinx White peers. Evidence-based treatments for adolescent depression exist, but Latinx adolescents face both universal and culture-specific barriers to receiving these treatments. The proposed study seeks to develop and test culturally-sensitive patient- and family-focused implementation strategies that will improve initiation of and retention in evidence-based psychotherapy for depression among Latinx adolescents.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: NARRATIVE Corticogeniculate circuits are in a unique position to regulate the feedforward flow of visual signals traveling from the retina to the cortex, however little is known about how corticogeniculate circuits contribute to vision. In the last grant period, we provided groundbreaking new evidence showing that corticogeniculate feedback to the visual thalamus controls the timing and precision of thalamic responses to incoming visual inputs. Building upon these findings, we apply intersecting and emerging technologies such as functional ultrasound imaging, optogenetics, chemogenetics, and neurophysiological recordings to understand the connectivity and function of corticogeniculate circuits in vision. Results of this study will further our understanding of how the brain prioritizes sensory signals arriving from the environment and could contribute to better understanding of disruptions in sensory perception observed in neurological disorders such as Autism Spectrum Disorder.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Rural residents experience substantial barriers in accessing healthy foods, but may also be exposed to other hazards of their local food environment through chemical contaminants ingested from dietary sources. This study will perform geographically detailed surveillance in rural Sullivan County, New York to identify how diet quality and dietary contaminants may interact to increase diabetes risk in rural communities. Findings will inform strategies to improve dietary behavior, reduce dietary chemical exposures, and prevent diabetes among rural residents.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: Narrative A growing body of evidence indicates that environmental information can be inherited, which suggests that changes in the mammalian germline can act as a trans-generational carrier of environmental information. Here, we describe a rat model developed in order to delineate heritable behavioral characteristics resulting from paternal self-administration of the psychostimulants cocaine and methamphetamine. The experiments described in this application will use state-of-the-art molecular and behavioral methodologies to examine epigenetic mechanisms whereby psychostimulant-associated information can be transmitted from sires to offspring and grand-offspring.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Blood-brain barrier disruption is a critical component in the pathology of stroke and contributes significantly to the poor clinical outcome. The proposed study will investigate the epigenetic mechanisms that contribute to an intact BBB and target these mechanisms to repair leaky BBB after stroke. If successful this therapeutic strategy targeting the BBB repair would be clinically relevant for patients suffering from several common neurological conditions.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Acetaminophen (APAP) exposures are ubiquitous use during pregnancy and early life during lung development. Alarmingly, clinical data support the hypothesis that the developing lung may be adversely affected by APAP exposure due to the developmental ontogeny of pulmonary CYP2E1 expression. These pre- clinical studies will be the first to interrogate the mechanisms underlying the unique susceptibility of the developing lung to APAP exposure and help determine its safety profile in this understudied population.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: Project Narrative The blueprint of embryonic development is encoded in an organism's genome, and access to these instructions is regulated by epigenetic systems. While much of the research on embryonic development has focused on the nature of the instructions themselves, less is understood about the epigenetic mechanisms that determine where and when such instructions are carried out. The project is relevant to NIH's mission to seek fundamental knowledge about living systems because it seeks to determine how epigenetic mechanisms influence the se- quence of events of early development and impact the formation of the embryo.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative The proposed research is highly relevant to public health because the identification of efficacious interventions that integrate mental health-exercise training to improve insulin resistance in adolescents with obesity and depression offers the prospect of mitigating type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk. Adolescent females from historically disadvantaged racial/ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds disproportionately experience elevated depression symptoms, physical inactivity, poor cardiorespiratory fitness, obesity, insulin resistance, and youth-onset T2D. By rigorously studying the efficacy of cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), exercise training, and their combinations to increase physical activity/fitness and ameliorate insulin resistance in adolescent females at-risk for T2D with elevated depression symptoms, the proposed research is poised to contribute to the NIDDK's mission to combat T2D and improve people's health and quality of life.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Renewal of this K24 Mid-Career Award in Patient-Oriented Research would enable the Principal Investigator, Dr. Supriya Mohile, to expand her research skills and mentoring activities to further the growth of a patient- oriented research program in geriatric oncology. Her multi-site cluster randomized studies have demonstrated that a geriatric assessment and management (GAM) intervention improves patient-centered and clinical outcomes of older patients with advanced cancer and their caregivers. The overarching research goals of this proposal are to: 1) develop and evaluate implementation strategies for GAM in oncology practices and 2) examine treatment tolerability in older patients with advanced cancer and aging-related conditions starting a new high-risk cancer treatment regimen.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Although molecular targeted therapy has dramatically changed how we treat cancer, the treatment for non Hodgkin’s lymphomas remains an unmet need for new therapeutic strategies. Our studies have uncovered that the MUSASHI2 (MSI2) contributes to B-cell lymphoma cell growth and drives resistance to a protein Arginine methyltransferase (PRMT) inhibitor. This proposal studies the PRMT-MSI2 axis in both mouse models and in human B-cell lymphoma to develop a new therapeutic strategy for this disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Given that suicide is the second leading cause of death of children and adolescents, this study addresses the National Institute of Mental Health's call for greater understanding of the brain/behavior mechanisms underlying youth suicide. Specifically, we will use functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) and real- world ecological momentary assessment (EMA) to advance what is known about the brain/behavior mechanisms underlying self-critical rumination (defined as persistent negative self-evaluation) and self- reassurance (providing compassion to self) in the context of youth suicide risk. Ultimately, greater understanding of these two constructs will facilitate the development of novel interventions targeting these symptom/circuit mechanisms related to youth suicide.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Usher Syndrome type II (USH2) is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner; however, in approximately 20% of patients with clinical features typical for USH2, only one mutation of USH2A has been identified by whole exome sequencing, thereby precluding a definitive diagnosis. Genomic assembly of the USH2A loci that combines the base-level accuracy of Illumina short-read sequencing with the longer read lengths obtained from Nanopore based amplification-free targeted sequencing will provide a more accurate detection of pathogenic variants in monoallelic USH2A patients. Candidate variants will be further interrogated using CRISPR-Cas9 editing technology in patient-derived retinal organoids to validate the pathogenicity of these novel non-coding variants and establish their sufficiency and necessity in causing disease in USH2A monoallelic subjects.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Hyperprolactinemia due to prolactin-secreting pituitary tumors frequently affects both the central and peripheral reproductive system, leading to hypogonadism and subfertility. Translational research has been limited by lack of pituitary tumor models. We have developed a unique 3-dimensional (3D) pituitary tumoroid culture system that can maintain differentiated prolactin-secreting pituitary tumor cells as a preclinical model for drug discovery.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Osteosarcoma (OS) is an aggressive primary bone cancer that mainly affects children and young adults, yet the survival rate has not changed in over three decades. The lack of effective therapies for OS is largely due to our limited understanding of OS biology, heterogeneity and drug resistance. This project will pioneer the application of tissue engineered 3D in vitro models to fill in the above gaps of knowledge and accelerate discovery of novel therapeutics to improve the treatment outcomes of this devastating disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The neuronal ceroid lipofuscinoses (NCLs) are among a number of lysosomal storage diseases that are characterized by progressive loss of vision culminating in blindness due to degeneration of both the retina and the central nervous system (CNS) visual pathways. Lysosomal storage diseases resulting from lack of specific soluble lysosomal enzymes, including the CLN2 form of NCL, can be treated by delivery of the missing enzyme to the affected tissues. Using a canine model for CLN2 disease, the proposed research will test the hypothesis that combined AAV- mediated gene therapy of the retina and CNS will prevent degeneration of both the retina and central visual pathways in this disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Narrative. A large fraction of our current medical arsenal operates through G protein-coupled receptors (GPCRs). This interdisciplinary team proposal investigates three underlying molecular mechanisms of GPCR engagement at the host-microbiota interface – gut microbiota-derived GPCR ligands (Aim 1a), candidate endogenous GPCR ligands from human tissues (Aim 1b), and bacterial metabolism of and responses to GPCR drugs (Aim 2). The proposed studies will represent a heretofore unprecedented structure-function-based exploration of the “dark matter” of the metabolome at the host-bacteria interface and how it is “sensed” by the host, which could broadly illuminate new GPCR- and microbiome-targeted therapeutic strategies.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative We will employ cutting-edge imaging techniques to investigate the dynamic interplay that takes place in the adult brain between cortical elements over the course of learning. The results from the proposed experiments will provide a higher level of understanding regarding the circuit and synaptic mechanisms that underlie perceptual learning. Our findings will provide a comprehensive framework under which to probe the progression of learning- related changes in the cortex and may lead to a deeper understanding of learning disabilities as well as uncovering novel avenues that promote plasticity in the mature brain after injury, stroke or prolonged sensory loss.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Narrative This research addresses the genetic underpinnings of adaptive trait evolution and reproductive isolation, and the determinants of genomic diversity. Understanding of the genetic architecture of human disease will benefit from this work’s emphases on detecting local adaptation (which is relevant to immune performance and the risk of diabetes and heart disease) and on interactions among genetic variants (which may contribute to the variable penetrance of many diseases). This research will benefit the study of insect disease vector evolution, and its focus on genetic incompatibilities may inform the causes of miscarriage and couple infertility and the disease risk of Neanderthal genetic variants.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF BIOMEDICAL IMAGING AND BIOENGINEERING
PHR: The goal of this proposal is to combine photodynamic therapy and magnetophoresis to improve the treatment of triple negative breast cancer. A photosensitizer-loaded magnetic nanoparticle will be used that exhibits minimal self-quenching of reactive oxygen species generation. Moreover, a novel magnetic device will be used to enhance the penetration of photosensitizer-loaded magnetic nanoparticles into tumors.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Lactobacilli bacteria are probiotic benefactors of human health that associate with mucosal tissues where they prevent infections, lower cancer risk, and improve metabolism, but the evolutionary pressures selecting for genes that confer their association with host mucosae are understudied. The goal of this proposal is to improve our understanding of how Lactobacillus plantarum surface proteins that recognize host-specific ligands favor competition between bacterial strains at the host mucosal surface. The work will reveal fundamental mechanisms that can be applied to engineer better probiotics for human health.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Spatial misperception is a common cause of injuries in elderly that are highly morbid and costly. Here we apply a rigorous framework to (i) parse out sensory contributions to spatial orientation in aging, (ii) and (ii) examine whether they correspond with age-related vestibular physiologic changes and fall risk. These are crucial steps to identify distinct age-related changes in spatial orientation and devise bi- omarkers to track aging effect on balance function.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis, a common fungal infection among immunocompromised patients, has poor outcomes including a high mortality rate. The increasing number of susceptible patients and the threat of antifungal-resistant strains makes the development of host-centric interventions a high priority for public health. This project will use mathematical modeling and experimental data to determine new potential treatments in this infection.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Alterations in sugar uptake and activity of facilitative sugar transporters – GLUTs - arise as a biomarker of metabolic diseases, such as obesity, diabetes, and cancer. Understanding the differences, the composition, and activity of GLUTs between cells provides the grounds for distinguishing cell types and subtypes and for more accurate detection of metabolically compromised cells. The current research established GLUT-specific fluorescently-labeled molecular probes for application in biochemical and biomedical research and cancer detection.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE: Cholestatic liver diseases, including biliary atresia, are the leading indication for pediatric liver transplantation. Evidence suggests that the unfolded protein response (UPR) is important in the progression of several adult liver diseases, yet the UPR is understudied in pediatric cholestatic liver diseases. We aim to define the role of the liver XBP1 pathway of the UPR postnatally and in models of cholestatic liver diseases in mice and human patients with biliary atresia in order to develop UPR specific therapeutic interventions for pediatric patients with cholestatic liver diseases.
